topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539e75ca63687203fcd50200#post_539e75ca63687203fcd50200
I'm not really familiar with them, but I will give an example of my own.

Nicodemus Arc de'Leone from the Dresden Files. 

For those who don't know he is pretty much the most evil character in that series that is not some sort of gibbering monstrosity from beyond space and time. He is the leader of a faction called The Nights of the Blackened Denarious, a group of humans who have taken up the 30 silver coins that Judas was paid in and work with the fallen angels imprisoned within to do nothing but spread evil and darkness across the land.

He works as both a tempter since these fallen angels grant terrible power to those who take up the coins and as a direct threat through a combination of competence, ruthlessness and being utterly, batshit EVIL.

And yet he's charming. He banters well, cares for his daughter and is operating out of genuine belief in his utterly monstrous cause.

He isn't some dupe you can feel sorry for, he's not a bad boy with an interestingly lost soul that needs redeeming, he is a complete and utter monster and yet he is an utterly fascinating one.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7
